result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caldon Rushing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Caldon Rushing appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Caldon Rushing.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  The defendant has been offered a DPA and would like a hearing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Caldon Rushing in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Caldon Rushing.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Toran is having his client take a TAD evaluation as he believes this should resolve with DPA.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Caldon Rushing in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Calendar call held.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Atty. Toran requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Caldon Rushing in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caldon Rushing appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 01.  Calendar call scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Caldon Rushing in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Toran has not received discovery or an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 048020,
Payable Number: 1007616,
Receipt Number: 22RP020312,
Amount: $20.00

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Associated Bank located at 7900 W Brown Deer Rd. Milwaukee WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Caldon Rushing in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 1:30p
